title: Creating a reading list of articles on knowledge graph construction from text involves selecting a mix of foundational papers, recent advancements, and specific case studies. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2022 that cover various aspects of this topic
**"A Survey of Knowledge Graph Embedding Approaches"** - This article provides an overview of different methods for embedding knowledge graphs, which is crucial for their construction and utilization

**"Open Information Extraction from the Web"** by Michele Banko et al. - A foundational paper on extracting structured information from unstructured text, which is a key step in knowledge graph construction

**"DeepDive: A Data Management System for Automatic Knowledge Base Construction"** by Ce Zhang et al. - Discusses a system that integrates machine learning and database techniques for knowledge base construction

author.given: A.Core of Semantic Knowledge" by Fabian M.Suchanek

title: - Describes the construction of the YAGO knowledge base, which is built from Wikipedia and WordNet

**"DBpedia: A Nucleus for a Web of Open Data"** by Christian Bizer et al. - Explores the creation of DBpedia, a project that extracts structured content from the information created in various Wikimedia projects

**"Knowledge Vault: A Web-Scale Approach to Probabilistic Knowledge Fusion"** by Xin Luna Dong et al. - Introduces a system for constructing a knowledge base by integrating information from multiple sources
**"Towards Open Knowledge Extraction"** by Gerhard Weikum et al. - Discusses methods for extracting knowledge from text in an open and scalable manner

author.given: Open Information Extraction on the Web" by Michael J.Cafarella

title: - Presents a system for extracting information from web text, which is a precursor to building knowledge graphs
**"T2KG: Transforming Text to Knowledge Graphs"** - A paper that discusses methodologies for converting textual data into structured knowledge graphs
- Provides insights into the challenges and techniques for building large-scale knowledge graphs from web data
**"Knowledge Graphs: Opportunities and Challenges"** by Paul Groth et al. - An overview of the potential and difficulties in constructing and using knowledge graphs

**"Bootstrapping a Large-Scale Entity and Relation Extractor from Wikipedia Text"** by Anthony Fader et al. - Discusses a method for extracting entities and relationships from Wikipedia, a common source for knowledge graphs
**"Ontology Learning from Text: An Overview"** by Philipp Cimiano et al. - Reviews techniques for automatically generating ontologies from text, which are essential for structuring knowledge graphs
**"A Survey on Open Information Extraction"** by Delia Rusu et al. - Provides a comprehensive overview of open information extraction techniques, which are crucial for knowledge graph construction

**"Building a Knowledge Graph from Natural Language Definitions for Interpretable Text Entailment"** - Explores the use of natural language processing to build knowledge graphs that can support text entailment tasks
**"Knowledge Graph Embedding: A Survey of Approaches and Applications"** - Reviews various embedding techniques that are used to represent knowledge graphs in a machine-readable format
Finding Extracted Entities in a Knowledge Base"** by Silviu Cucerzan - Discusses the process of linking text-extracted entities to a knowledge base, a critical step in knowledge graph construction
**"Towards a Universal Open Information Extraction"** by Oren Etzioni et al. - Proposes a framework for extracting information from text that can be universally applied to build knowledge graphs
**"Knowledge Graphs and Their Role in Semantic Search"** by Stefan Dietze et al. - Examines how knowledge graphs enhance semantic search capabilities, which is a key application of these structures

**"From Text to Knowledge: The Information Extraction Pipeline"** - Describes the end-to-end process of extracting structured knowledge from text, highlighting the challenges and solutions at each stage
These articles provide a comprehensive view of the field, covering theoretical foundations, practical implementations, and emerging trends in knowledge graph construction from text
